pr_title: eth_gasPrice based on median block cost (#1546)

timeline.message:
eth_gasPrice based on median block cost (#1546)

Update eth_gasPrice to return the median gas price of transactions in
the last 100 blocks (or whole chain if the chain is short).  If there
are no TXes return the old value.

Signed-off-by: Danno Ferrin <danno.ferrin@gmail.com>

we need to support GraphQL too.

timeline.bodyText: I think this case should be an orElseThrow? It doesn't represent a normal case.

@@ -715,6 +733,34 @@ private TransactionWithMetadata transactionByHeaderAndIndex(
     return header.map(BlockHeader::getStateRoot).flatMap(worldStateArchive::getMutable);
   }
 
+  public Optional<Long> gasPrice() {
+    final long blockHeight = headBlockNumber();
+    final long[] gasCollection =
+        LongStream.range(Math.max(0, blockHeight - apiConfig.getGasPriceBlocks()), blockHeight)
+            .mapToObj(
+                l ->
+                    blockchain
+                        .getBlockByNumber(l)
+                        .map(Block::getBody)
+                        .map(BlockBody::getTransactions)
+                        .orElse(Collections.emptyList()))

replies.bodyText:
It felt like an "it could never happen situation," if we can't get blocks by number behind the head block.  Throwing an error does seem more appropriate instead of silently healing.
I supposed if we are querying the gas right when we decide to switch to a shorter but heavier chain it might catch those blocks.  Simply send another request in that case.
